comments.body: Please move the new parameter the end for backward compatibility.
These should be guarded with https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/compat/compat.py for forward compatibility

        num_params_biases = self._num_params
        weights, biases = gen_cudnn_rnn_ops.cudnn_rnn_params_to_canonical_v2(
            num_layers=self._num_layers,
            num_units=self._num_units,

comments.body:
I think I have already added tests for this feature (with time_major parameter). My original commit has (in cudnn_rnn_ops_test.py), which force uses to provide both variable_seq_lengths and time_major.
```
if not variable_seq_lengths and not time_major:	
      self.skipTest("Batch major not supported")
```
But now I remove these lines (see commit 9c27326b98f975dd04908defd9c6925e9263aa78). So it has the tests on this branch (time_major but no variable_seq_length)
The tests didn't not cover dynamic shape input, thats why the previous commit's problem wasn't caught.
OIC. Could you please point me to some example code in other ops unittest about adding the tf.placeholder and feed_dict?
No worries. I found some examples. Will update it.

    sequence_lengths = array_ops.fill([batch_size], max_time)
    args["sequence_lengths"] = sequence_lengths
    args["time_major"] = time_major
